cards.name: Juniper Order Druid
cards.text: {T}: Untap target land.
cards.flavor:
"The filthy towns of Kjeldor are no place for anyone to live. Fyndhorn is our home now."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order
cards.originalText: {T}: Untap target land. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Lhurgoyf
cards.text: Lhurgoyf's power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.
cards.flavor:
"Ach! Hans, run! It's the Lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words
cards.originalText: Lhurgoyf has power equal to the total number of creatures in all graveyards and toughness equal to 1 plus the total number of creatures in all graveyards.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

rulings.text: Lure doesn't give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

As blockers are declared, any creature that's tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can't block doesn't block. If there's a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't block if that cost isn't paid.

cards.originalText: All creatures able to block target creature must do so. Lure does not prevent a creature from blocking more than one creature if blocker has that ability. If blocker is forced to block more creatures than it is allowed to, defender chooses which of these creatures to block, but must block as many creatures as allowed.

cards.name: Maddening Wind
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Cumulative upkeep {G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Maddening Wind deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"It is Freyalise, walking on the world."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order
cards.originalText:
Cumulative Upkeep: {G}
During target creature's controller's upkeep, Maddening Wind deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.name: Nature's Lore
cards.text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"Fyndhorn is our home."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

cards.originalText: Search your library for any forest and put it directly into play. This does not count towards your one land per turn limit. Reshuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Pale Bears
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor:
"Daughter, on the day you have killed your Pale Bear, then will I give you your true name."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain
cards.originalText: Islandwalk

cards.name: Pygmy Allosaurus
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
"I don't understand the appeal of keeping these things as pets, unless you want your children eaten."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.originalText: Swampwalk

cards.name: Pyknite
cards.text: When Pyknite enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Never cross a Pyknite, if you value your scalp."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain
cards.originalText: Draw a card at the beginning of the upkeep of the turn after Pyknite comes into play.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"Faith in Freyalise has given me the gift, not the curse, of unprecedented longevity."
—Laina of the Elvish Council
cards.originalText:
When Regeneration comes into play, choose target creature.
{G}: Regenerate creature Regeneration enchants.

cards.name: Rime Dryad
cards.text: Snow forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a snow Forest.)
cards.flavor:
"The Dryads told us to stay, as no new horrors would come when it was so cold. Three of us left anyway. The rest believed their lies, and their skeletons weren't found until the thaw."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

rulings.text: Can't landwalk through a non-Snow Forest.

cards.originalText: Snow-covered forestwalk

cards.name: Ritual of Subdual
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If a land is tapped for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of any other type.
cards.flavor:
"That which does not bend to the will of Freyalise shall surely break."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

rulings.text: This effect changes the type of mana produced, but not the amount. For example, if a land that's tapped for mana would add {W}{W} to its controller's mana pool, it adds {C}{C} to that player's mana pool instead.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative Upkeep: {2}
All mana-producing lands produce colorless mana instead of their normal mana.

cards.name: Scaled Wurm
cards.flavor:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these Wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

cards.name: Shambling Strider
cards.text: {R}{G}: Shambling Strider gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Freyalise forbid that any stranger should wander into the Striders' territory.
cards.originalText: {R}{G}: +1/-1 until end of turn

cards.name: Snowblind
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -X/-Y. If that creature is attacking, X is the number of snow lands defending player controls. Otherwise, X is the number of snow lands its controller controls. Y is equal to X or to enchanted creature's toughness minus 1, whichever is smaller.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -*/-*. When that creature attacks, * is equal to the number of snow-covered lands defending player controls. At other times, * is equal to the number of snow-covered lands its controller controls. If this reduces the creature's toughness to less than 1, the creature's toughness is 1.

cards.name: Stampede
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We could see the horizon blacken with the great beasts, but it was too late. The icefield offered no immediate safety, but luckily most of us reached a crevasse in which we could take cover."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.originalText: All attacking creatures gain trample and get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Stunted Growth
cards.text: Target player chooses three cards from their hand and puts them on top of their library in any order.
cards.originalText: Target player chooses three cards from his or her hand and puts them on top of his or her library in any order. If that player does not have enough cards in hand, his or her entire hand is put on top of his or her library in any order.

cards.name: Tarpan
cards.text: When Tarpan dies, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"A good Tarpan will serve you, faithful and true. A bad one will kick you in the head."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.originalText: If Tarpan is put into the graveyard from play, gain 1 life.

cards.name: Thermokarst
cards.text: Destroy target land. If that land was a snow land, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Finally we understand the lesson of our home: loss begets renewal."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order
cards.originalText: Destroy target land. If that land is a snow-covered land, gain 1 life.

cards.name: Thoughtleech
cards.text: Whenever an Island an opponent controls becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"A resourceful mage has many sources of information. The best one is your foe."
—Zur the Enchanter
cards.originalText: Whenever an island controlled by target opponent becomes tapped, gain 1 life.

cards.name: Tinder Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Add {R}{R}.
{R}, Sacrifice Tinder Wall: It deals 2 damage to target creature it's blocking.
cards.originalText:
{0}: Sacrifice Tinder Wall to add {R}{R} to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.
{R}: Sacrifice Tinder Wall to have it deal 2 damage to target creature it blocks.

cards.name: Touch of Vitae
cards.text:
Until end of turn, target creature gains haste and "{0}: Untap this creature. Activate this ability only once."
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.originalText: Target creature may untap one additional time this turn. That creature may attack or use abilities that require {T} as part of the activation cost this turn. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Trailblazer
cards.text: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Our Elvish Hunter Taaveti led us swiftly along hidden paths through the dense forest. We caught the Orcs from behind, and completely by surprise."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield
cards.originalText: Target creature cannot be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Venomous Breath
cards.text: Choose target creature. At this turn's next end of combat, destroy all creatures that blocked or were blocked by it this turn.

rulings.text: It affects creatures that had blocked the target when this spell resolves, even if they are no longer blocking the creature.

cards.originalText: At end of combat, destroy all creatures blocking or blocked by target creature this turn.

cards.name: Wall of Pine Needles
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate Wall of Pine Needles.
cards.flavor: The power of the forest takes a hundred forms. Some are more surprising than others.
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate

cards.name: Whiteout
cards.text:
All creatures lose flying until end of turn.
Sacrifice a snow land: Return Whiteout from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText:
All creatures with flying lose flying until end of turn.
If Whiteout is in your graveyard, you may sacrifice a snow-covered land to return Whiteout to your hand.

cards.name: Wiitigo
cards.text:
Wiitigo enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Wiitigo if it has blocked or been blocked since your last upkeep. Otherwise, remove a +1/+1 counter from it.

rulings.text: Any +1/+1 counter from any source can be used with his ability.

cards.originalText:
When Wiitigo comes into play, put six +1/+1 counters on it.
During your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Wiitigo if it has blocked or been blocked since your last upkeep. Otherwise, remove a +1/+1 counter from Wiitigo. Ignore this effect if there are no counters left on Wiitigo.

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.
cards.flavor:
"Here in Fyndhorn, where Freyalise's power is strongest, the forest has its own opinion."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

rulings.text: The additional mana is not an ability of the land and is not something the land can produce.

cards.originalText: Wild Growth adds {G} to your mana pool whenever target land is tapped for mana.

cards.name: Woolly Mammoths
cards.text: Woolly Mammoths has trample as long as you control a snow land.
cards.flavor:
"Mammoths may be good to ride on, but they're certainly bad to fall off of!"
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.originalText: Gains trample as long as you control any snow-covered lands.

cards.name: Woolly Spider
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Woolly Spider blocks a creature with flying, Woolly Spider gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We need not fear the forces of the air; I've yet to see a Spider without an appetite."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter
cards.originalText:
Can block creatures with flying.
If Woolly Spider is assigned to block a creature with flying, Woolly Spider gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Yavimaya Gnats
cards.text:
Flying
{G}: Regenerate Yavimaya Gnats.
cards.flavor:
"It is our third day of travel on the Yavimaya River, and still these creatures plague us. Davin Lansson, our naturalist, has facetiously labeled them 'gnats,' and the name has stuck."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.originalText:
Flying
{G}: Regenerate

cards.name: Aggression
cards.text:
Enchant non-Wall creature
Enchanted creature has first strike and trample.
At the beginning of the end step of enchanted creature's controller, destroy that creature if it didn't attack this turn.
cards.flavor: The star that burns twice as bright burns half as long.

rulings.text: Moving the enchantment after the ability triggers will not affect which creatures are affected.

cards.originalText: Target non-wall creature gains first strike and trample. At the end of its controller's turn, destroy that creature if it did not attack that turn.

cards.name: Anarchy
cards.text: Destroy all white permanents.
cards.flavor:
"The Shaman waved the staff, and the land itself went mad."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.originalText: Destroy all white permanents.

cards.name: Avalanche
cards.text: Destroy X target snow lands.
cards.flavor:
"The pass was completely blocked by the avalanche; we're forced to turn back. Nevertheless, we've gone farther and seen more than any before us."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.originalText: Destroy X target snow-covered lands.

cards.name: Balduvian Barbarians
cards.flavor:
"Barbarian raids were a concern to those living in the northwest provinces, but the Skyknights never dealt with the problem in a systematic way. They thought of the Balduvians as an 'amusing model' of their forebears' culture."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

cards.name: Balduvian Hydra
cards.text:
Balduvian Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+0 counters on it.
Remove a +1/+0 counter from Balduvian Hydra: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Balduvian Hydra this turn.
{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+0 counter on Balduvian Hydra. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.originalText:
When Balduvian Hydra comes into play, put X +1/+0 counters on it.
{0}: Remove a +1/+0 counter from Balduvian Hydra to prevent 1 damage to Balduvian Hydra.
{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+0 counter on Balduvian Hydra. Use this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Barbarian Guides
cards.text: {2}{R}, {T}: Choose a land type. Target creature you control gains snow landwalk of the chosen type until end of turn. Return that creature to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a snow land of that type.)

rulings.text: You choose a land subtype, and if the defending player controls any snow lands with that subtype, the targeted creature can't be blocked.

cards.originalText: {2}{R},{T}: Target creature you control gains a snow-covered landwalk ability of your choice until end of turn. At end of turn, return that creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Battle Frenzy
cards.text:
Green creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
Nongreen creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"One day you, too, shall drink the blood of your foes. It is something to look forward to."
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain
cards.originalText: All green creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn. All non-green creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Bone Shaman
cards.text: {B}: Until end of turn, Bone Shaman gains "Creatures dealt damage by Bone Shaman this turn can't be regenerated this turn."
cards.flavor:
Rattle me bones as I cross the floor
And the bones in your grave will rattle no more.
cards.originalText: {B}: Any creature damaged by Bone Shaman this turn cannot regenerate until end of turn.

cards.name: Brand of Ill Omen
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Cumulative upkeep {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Enchanted creature's controller can't cast creature spells.
cards.flavor:
"Let those who bear the brand receive no shelter, no kindness, and no comfort from our people."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative Upkeep: {R}
Target creature's controller cannot cast summon spells.

cards.name: Chaos Lord
cards.text:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent gains control of Chaos Lord if the number of permanents is even.
Chaos Lord can attack as though it had haste unless it entered the battlefield this turn.

rulings.text: This creature's changing of controllers is a new effect each upkeep so it will take precedence over any other control effects. This means that using another control-changing effect won't guarantee that you keep it.

cards.originalText:
First strike
Chaos Lord can attack the first turn it comes into play on a side, except the turn it first comes into play. During your upkeep, count the number of permanents. If that number is even, target opponent gains control of Chaos Lord.

cards.name: Chaos Moon
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, count the number of permanents. If the number is odd, until end of turn, red creatures get +1/+1 and whenever a player taps a Mountain for mana, that player adds an additional {R}. If the number is even, until end of turn, red creatures get -1/-1 and if a player taps a Mountain for mana, that Mountain produces colorless mana instead of any other type.

rulings.text: In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

cards.originalText: During each player's upkeep, count the number of permanents. If that number is odd, all red creatures get +1/+1 and mountains produce an additional {R} when tapped for mana until end of turn. If the number is even, all red creatures get -1/-1 and mountains produce colorless mana instead of their normal mana until end of turn.

cards.name: Conquer
cards.text:
Enchant land
You control enchanted land.
cards.flavor:
"Why do we trade with those despicable Elves? You don't live in forests, you burn them!"
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald
cards.originalText: Gain control of target land.

cards.name: Curse of Marit Lage
cards.text:
When Curse of Marit Lage enters the battlefield, tap all Islands.
Islands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor:
"Our world has not felt her thundering steps in lifetimes, but Marit Lage's presence is still with us."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest
cards.originalText: When Curse of Marit Lage comes into play, tap all islands. Islands do not untap during their controller's untap phase.

cards.name: Dwarven Armory
cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice a land: Put a +2/+2 counter on target creature. Activate this ability only during any upkeep step.
cards.flavor:
"Few of us left, now. Confounded Yeti have opened all the vents. We'd best hide here with the weapons."
—Perena Deepcutter,
Dwarven Armorer

rulings.text: The ability can be activated during your opponent's upkeep as well as your own. The upkeep restriction is there to avoid its use during combat.

cards.originalText: {2}: Sacrifice a land to put a +2/+2 counter on target creature. Use this ability only during upkeep.

cards.name: Errantry
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and can only attack alone.
cards.flavor:
"There is no shame in solitude. The lone Knight may succeed where a hundred founder."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

rulings.text: "Can only attack alone" means the enchanted creature can't be declared as an attacker during the declare attackers step unless no other creatures are declared as attackers at that time (either by you or your Two-Headed Giant teammate).
If the enchanted creature attacks alone, then a spell or ability causes another creature to be put onto the battlefield attacking, that's fine.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+0. If that creature attacks, no other creatures can attack this turn.

cards.name: Flame Spirit
cards.text: {R}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The spirit of the flame is the spirit of change."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain
cards.originalText: {R}: +1/+0 until end of turn

cards.name: Flare
cards.text:
Flare deals 1 damage to any target.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"I strive for elegance and speed in my work."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
cards.originalText: Flare deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Game of Chaos
cards.text: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, you gain 1 life and target opponent loses 1 life, and you decide whether to flip again. If you lose the flip, you lose 1 life and that opponent gains 1 life, and that player decides whether to flip again. Double the life stakes with each flip.

rulings.text: To "double the life stakes" means to double the amount of life lost or gained.

cards.originalText: Flip a coin; target opponent calls heads or tails while coin is in the air. If the flip ends up in your favor, you gain 1 life and that opponent loses 1 life. Otherwise, you lose 1 life and the opponent gains 1 life. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life. The winner of each round decides whether to continue. Double the stakes in life each round.

cards.name: Glacial Crevasses
cards.text: Sacrifice a snow Mountain: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor:
"We were chasing Lim-Dûl when the ridge in front of us suddenly crumbled. I can't believe it was mere coincidence."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield
cards.originalText: {0}: Sacrifice a snow-covered mountain. No creatures deal damage in combat this turn.

cards.name: Goblin Mutant
cards.text:
Trample
Goblin Mutant can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater.
Goblin Mutant can't block creatures with power 3 or greater.
cards.flavor: If only it had three brains, too.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Cannot attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power greater than 2. Cannot be assigned to block any creature with power greater than 2.

cards.name: Goblin Sappers
cards.text:
{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature you control can't be blocked this turn. Destroy it and Goblin Sappers at end of combat.
{R}{R}{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature you control can't be blocked this turn. Destroy it at end of combat.

rulings.text: If you activate the ability during the end of combat step, the creature will be destroyed at the beginning of the next end of combat step, even if that step occurs during a different turn.

cards.originalText:
{R}{R},{T}: Target creature you control cannot be blocked this turn. At end of combat, destroy that creature and Goblin Sappers.
{R}{R}{R}{R},{T}: Target creature you control cannot be blocked this turn. At end of combat, destroy that creature.

cards.name: Goblin Ski Patrol
cards.text: {1}{R}: Goblin Ski Patrol gets +2/+0 and gains flying. Its controller sacrifices it at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only once and only if you control a snow Mountain.
cards.flavor:
"AIIIEEEE!"
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

rulings.text: Goblin Ski Patrol's ability may be activated only once in the entire game. If its ability is activated and then it changes controllers, its ability may not be activated again, and its new controller will still have to sacrifice it at the beginning of the End step.

cards.originalText: {1}{R}: Flying and +2/+0. At end of turn, bury Goblin Ski Patrol. Use this ability only once and only if you control any snow-covered mountains.

cards.name: Goblin Snowman
cards.text:
Whenever Goblin Snowman blocks, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by it this turn.
{T}: Goblin Snowman deals 1 damage to target creature it's blocking.
cards.flavor:
"Strength in numbers? Right."
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician
cards.originalText:
When blocking, Goblin Snowman neither deals nor receives damage in combat.
{T}: Goblin Snowman deals 1 damage to target creature it blocks.

cards.name: Grizzled Wolverine
cards.text: {R}: Grizzled Wolverine gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during the declare blockers step, only if at least one creature is blocking Grizzled Wolverine, and only once each turn.
cards.flavor:
"Before you release a Wolverine from the trap, make sure it's really dead."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

rulings.text: It can only get +2/+0 even if more than one creature blocks it.

cards.originalText: {R}: +2/+0 until end of turn. Use this ability only when a creature is assigned to block Grizzled Wolverine and only once each turn.

cards.name: Imposing Visage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has menace. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"I can't believe they expect me to fight with this rabble. A Goblin in a big mask sends 'em running for cover."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald
cards.originalText: Target creature cannot be blocked by only one creature.

cards.name: Incinerate
cards.text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to any target. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Yes, I think 'toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

rulings.text: Regeneration abilities that would affect that creature can still be activated; they just won't do anything. The creature can't be regenerated for any reason, even if an effect other than Incinerate would deal lethal damage to it or otherwise destroy it.

cards.originalText: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. No creature damaged by Incinerate can regenerate this turn.

cards.name: Jokulhaups
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"I was shocked when I first saw the aftermath of the Yavimaya Valley disaster. The raging waters had swept away trees, bridges, and even houses. My healers had much work to do."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest
cards.originalText: Bury all artifacts, creatures, and lands.

cards.name: Karplusan Giant
cards.text: Tap an untapped snow land you control: Karplusan Giant gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"They aren't the brightest or the quickest of Giants. For that matter, the same holds true if you compare them to rocks."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.originalText: {0}: Tap target snow-covered land you control to give Karplusan Giant +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Karplusan Yeti
cards.text: {T}: Karplusan Yeti deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Karplusan Yeti.
cards.flavor:
"What's that smell?"
—Perena Deepcutter,
Dwarven Armorer

rulings.text: Giving either creature first strike does not affect the ability.

If this leaves the battlefield before its activated ability resolves, it will still deal damage to the targeted creature. On the other hand, if the targeted creature leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the ability won't resolve and no damage will be dealt.

cards.originalText: {T}: Karplusan Yeti deals an amount of damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals an amount of damage equal to its power to Karplusan Yeti.

cards.name: Lava Burst
cards.text: Lava Burst deals X damage to any target. If Lava Burst would deal damage to a creature, that damage can't be prevented or dealt instead to another permanent or player.
cards.flavor:
"Overkill? This isn't a game of Kick-the-Ouphe!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

rulings.text: Prevention and redirection effects will have no effect on damage dealt by Lava Burst to a creature. However, they will work on damage that Lava Burst would deal to a player.
A creature dealt damage by Lava Burst may be regenerated.

cards.originalText: Lava Burst deals X damage to target creature or player. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to protect that creature.

cards.name: Márton Stromgald
cards.text:
Whenever Márton Stromgald attacks, other attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn for each attacking creature other than Márton Stromgald.
Whenever Márton Stromgald blocks, other blocking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn for each blocking creature other than Márton Stromgald.
cards.originalText: If Márton Stromgald attacks, all other attacking creatures get +*/+* until end of turn, where * is equal to the number of other attacking creatures. If Márton blocks, all other blocking creatures get +*/+* until end of turn, where * is equal to the number of other blocking creatures.

cards.name: Melee
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during your turn and only during combat before blockers are declared.
You choose which creatures block this combat and how those creatures block.
Whenever a creature attacks and isn't blocked this combat, untap it and remove it from combat.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can be cast during any of them as long as it's before the beginning of that phase's Declare Blockers Step.

cards.originalText: Cast only on your turn during combat before defense is chosen. Choose how attacking creatures you control are blocked; all defense must be legal. After declaring blocking, untap any unblocked attacking creature. Treat those creatures as though they had not attacked.

cards.name: Melting
cards.text: All lands are no longer snow.
cards.flavor:
"Who needs the sun when you've got me around?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
cards.originalText: All snow-covered lands become non-snow-covered lands of the same type.

cards.name: Meteor Shower
cards.text: Meteor Shower deals X plus 1 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
cards.flavor:
"Eenie, meenie, minie, moe . . . oh, why not all of them?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

rulings.text: You can't choose to do fractional damage to a target.

A tip on how this math works: To deal a total of 1 damage, X is 0. The cost is {0} + {0} + {R} = {R}. To deal a total of 2 damage, X is 1. The cost is {1} + {1} + {R} = {2}{R}. To deal a total of 3 damage, X is 2. The cost is {2} + {2} + {R} = {4}{R}. And so on.
The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most X + 1. You divide the damage as you cast Meteor Shower, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

cards.originalText: Meteor Shower deals X+1 damage divided any way you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Mountain Goat
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor:
"Folklore has it that to capture a Mountain Goat is a sign of divine blessing. I just know it's a sign that dinner is on the way."
—Klazina Jansdotter, Leader of the Order of the Sacred Torch
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk

cards.name: Mudslide
cards.text:
Creatures without flying don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped creatures without flying they control and pay {2} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

rulings.text: First the player chooses all the tapped creatures they would like to untap this way. Then the entire payment is made at once, then all of those creatures untap at the same time. If the entire payment can't be paid (because the player chose too many creatures, for example), none of it is paid and none of those creatures untap.

cards.originalText: Creatures without flying do not untap during their controller's untap phase. At the end of his or her upkeep, each player may pay an additional {2} per creature to untap a creature without flying he or she controls.

cards.name: Orcish Cannoneers
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Cannoneers deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"It's a thankless job, and you'll probably die in an explosion. But the pay is pretty good."
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain
cards.originalText: {T}: Orcish Cannoneers deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Orcish Conscripts
cards.text:
Orcish Conscripts can't attack unless at least two other creatures attack.
Orcish Conscripts can't block unless at least two other creatures block.
cards.originalText: Cannot be declared as attacking unless at least two other creatures are also declared as attacking. Cannot be assigned to block unless at least two other creatures are also assigned to block.

cards.name: Orcish Farmer
cards.text: {T}: Target land becomes a Swamp until its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"Yes, the Farmers keep our soldiers fed. But why do they have to make every battlefield a pigpen?"
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

rulings.text: This ability changes the targeted land's land types. It doesn't affect its name, its supertypes (such as whether or not it's legendary, snow, or basic), or its other types (if it's also a creature, for example). The ability will cause the land to lose all of its printed abilities and gain the ability "{T}: Add {B}."

cards.originalText: {T}: Target land becomes a swamp until its controller's next untap phase.

cards.name: Orcish Healer
cards.text:
{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.
{B}{B}{R}, {T}: Regenerate target black or green creature.
{R}{G}{G}, {T}: Regenerate target black or green creature.
cards.originalText:
{R}{R},{T}: Target creature cannot regenerate this turn.
{R}{B}{B},{T}: Regenerate target black or green creature.
{R}{G}{G},{T}: Regenerate target black or green creature.

cards.name: Orcish Librarian
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Look at the top eight cards of your library. Exile four of them at random, then put the rest on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
Us hungry, need food . . . .
Lots of books . . . . Hmm . . . .

rulings.text: You do get to look at the remaining 4 cards before deciding which order to put them back in.

cards.originalText: {R},{T}: Take the top eight cards of your library; remove four of them at random from the game. Put the remaining four on top of your library in any order.

cards.name: Orcish Lumberjack
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Add three mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G}.
cards.flavor:
"How did I ever let myself get talked into this project?"
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain
cards.originalText: {T}: Sacrifice a forest to add three mana in any combination of red and/or green to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Orcish Squatters
cards.text: Whenever Orcish Squatters attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain control of target land defending player controls for as long as you control Orcish Squatters. If you do, Orcish Squatters assigns no combat damage this turn.

rulings.text: The ability triggers on the declaration of blockers if no blockers are declared for it.
If you lose control of Orcish Squatters before its ability resolves, you won't gain control of the targeted land at all.

An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: If Orcish Squatters attacks and is not blocked, you may gain control of target land controlled by defending player. If you do so, Orcish Squatters deals no damage in combat this turn. Lose control of that land if Orcish Squatters leaves play or if you lose control of Orcish Squatters.

cards.name: Panic
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"If you'd been there, you would've run from that deer, too!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can be cast during any of them as long as it's before the beginning of that phase's Declare Blockers Step.

cards.originalText: Target creature cannot block this turn. Cast only during combat before defense is chosen. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Pyroblast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's blue.
• Destroy target permanent if it's blue.
cards.flavor:
"Just the thing for those pesky water mages."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

rulings.text: The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can't be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.
Pyroblast can target any spell or permanent, not just a blue one. It checks the color of the target only on resolution.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell if it is blue or destroy target permanent if it is blue.

cards.name: Pyroclasm
cards.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor:
"Leaves more room for the big ones to fight in, you know."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
cards.originalText: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Sabretooth Tiger
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor:

Balduvian Chieftain

cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:

rulings.text: Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact.

cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Stone Spirit
cards.text: Stone Spirit can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"The spirit of the stone is the spirit of strength."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) can block this because they don't actually have Flying.

cards.originalText: Cannot be blocked by creatures with flying.

cards.name: Stonehands
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Trust in the power of stone. Stone is strong; stone shatters swords; stone breaks bones. Trust in stone."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +0/+2.
{R}: Creature Stonehands enchants gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Tor Giant
cards.flavor:
"What do you do then? Run. Run very fast. Don't stop until you see the camp—or a bigger Giant."
—Toothlicker Harj,
Orcish Captain

cards.name: Total War
cards.text: Whenever a player attacks with one or more creatures, destroy all untapped non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn't attack, except for creatures the player hasn't controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn.

rulings.text: Destroys creatures as a triggered ability on the declaration of attackers.

cards.originalText: Whenever any player declares an attack, destroy all untapped non-wall creatures that player controls that don't attack. Do not destroy creatures the player did not control at the beginning of the turn.

cards.name: Vertigo
cards.text: Vertigo deals 2 damage to target creature with flying. That creature loses flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I saw the wizard gesturing, but I didn't guess his plan until my Aesthir cried out and went into a dive."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight
cards.originalText: Vertigo deals 2 damage to target creature with flying; that creature loses flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Wall of Lava
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Lava gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Now there's something you don't see every day."

cards.originalText: {R}: +1/+1 until end of turn

cards.name: Word of Blasting
cards.text: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated. Word of Blasting deals damage equal to that Wall's converted mana cost to the Wall's controller.
cards.flavor:
"Walls? What walls?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
cards.originalText: Bury target wall. Word of Blasting deals an amount of damage equal to that wall's casting cost to the wall's controller.

cards.name: Adarkar Unicorn
cards.text: {T}: Add {U} or {C}{U}. Spend this mana only to pay cumulative upkeep costs.
cards.flavor:
"There is no nobler creature in all of Terisiare."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.originalText: {T}: Add either {U} or {U} and one colorless mana to your mana pool. This mana is usable only for cumulative upkeep. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Arctic Foxes
cards.text: Arctic Foxes can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or greater as long as defending player controls a snow land.
cards.flavor:
"Those Foxes are wily, swift, and ferocious. They are the warriors of the snows."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.originalText: If defending player controls any snow-covered lands, no creature with power greater than 1 may be assigned to block Arctic Foxes.

cards.name: Arenson's Aura
cards.text:
{W}, Sacrifice an enchantment: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.flavor:

—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest
cards.originalText:
{W}: Sacrifice an enchantment to destroy target enchantment.
{3}{U}{U}: Counter target enchantment.

cards.name: Armor of Faith
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

Target creature gets +1/+1.
{W}: Creature Armor of Faith enchants gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.text:
Untap all white creatures you control.
Whenever a creature blocks this turn, it gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"In the thick of battle, you must keep your wits about you. Yelling a lot helps, too."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.originalText: Untap all white creatures you control. Any creature that blocks this turn gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Black Scarab
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by black creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as an opponent controls a black permanent.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +2/+2 as long as any opponent controls any black cards. That creature cannot be blocked by black creatures.

You gain 1 life.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

—Halvor Arenson,
Kjeldoran Priest

cards.text: {0}: Return Blinking Spirit to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Don't look at it! Maybe it'll go away!"
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician
cards.originalText: {0}: Return Blinking Spirit to owner's hand.

cards.name: Blue Scarab
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by blue creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as an opponent controls a blue permanent.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +2/+2 as long as any opponent controls any blue cards. That creature cannot be blocked by blue creatures.

cards.name: Call to Arms
cards.text:
As Call to Arms enters the battlefield, choose a color and an opponent.
White creatures get +1/+1 as long as the chosen color is the most common color among nontoken permanents the chosen player controls but isn't tied for most common.
When the chosen color isn't the most common color among nontoken permanents the chosen player controls or is tied for most common, sacrifice Call to Arms.

rulings.text: You can't choose "colorless" as a color.
Call to Arms affects all white creatures, not just white creatures you control.

If Call to Arms changes controllers, it will continue to check the nontoken permanents controlled by the player chosen as it entered the battlefield, even if that player isn't an opponent of its current controller.

The game continually counts the number of nontoken permanents of each color the chosen player controls. Multicolored ones are counted for each of their colors; colorless ones are ignored. The moment the number of nontoken permanents of the chosen color that player controls is less than or equal to the number of permanents of one of the other colors that player controls, Call to Arms's second ability stops giving white creatures +1/+1 and its third ability triggers. Call to Arms will be sacrificed when the third ability resolves, even if those numbers have changed by then.

Call to Arms's third ability is a "state trigger." Once a state trigger triggers, it won't trigger again as long as the ability is on the stack. If the ability is countered and the trigger condition is still true, it will immediately trigger again.

cards.originalText: Choose a color. As long as target opponent controls more cards of that color than any other color, all white creatures get +1/+1. If at any time that opponent does not control more cards of that color than any other color, bury Call to Arms.

cards.name: Caribou Range
cards.text:
Enchant land you control
Enchanted land has "{W}{W}, {T}: Create a 0/1 white Caribou creature token."
Sacrifice a Caribou token: You gain 1 life.

rulings.text: You can only sacrifice a Caribou token to this, not any creature with the type Caribou.

cards.originalText:
When Caribou Range comes into play, choose target land you control.
{W}{W}: Tap land Caribou Range enchants to put a Caribou token into play. Treat this token as a 0/1 white creature.
{0}: Sacrifice a Caribou token to gain 1 life.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage against you from one black source. If a source deals damage to you more than once in a turn, you may pay {1} each time to prevent the damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
cards.text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage against you from one blue source. If a source deals damage to you more than once in a turn, you may pay {1} each time to prevent the damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Green
cards.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage against you from one green source. If a source deals damage to you more than once in a turn, you may pay {1} each time to prevent the damage.
